fcgio.h

00001 //
00002 // Provides support for FastCGI via C++ iostreams.
00003 //
00004 // $Id: fcgio.h,v 1.15 2002/02/25 13:16:11 robs Exp $
00005 //
00006 // This work is based on routines written by George Feinberg. They
00007 // have been mostly re-written and extensively changed by
00008 // Michael Richards.
00009 //
00010 // Rewritten again with bug fixes and numerous enhancements by
00011 // Michael Shell.
00012 // 
00013 // And rewritten again by Rob Saccoccio. 
00014 //
00015 // Special Thanks to Dietmar Kuehl for his help and the numerous custom
00016 // streambuf examples on his web site.
00017 //
00018 // Copyright (c) 2000 Tux the Linux Penguin
00019 // Copyright (c) 2001 Rob Saccoccio and Chelsea Networks
00020 //
00021 // You are free to use this software without charge or royalty
00022 // as long as this notice is not removed or altered, and recognition
00023 // is given to the author(s)
00024 //
00025 // This code is offered as-is without any warranty either expressed or
00026 // implied; without even the implied warranty of MERCHANTABILITY or
00027 // FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.  If it breaks, you get to keep 
00028 // both halves.

00030 #ifndef FCGIO_H
00031 #define FCGIO_H
00032 
00033 #include <iostream>
00034 
00035 #include "fcgiapp.h"
00036 
00037 #ifndef DLLAPI
00038 #ifdef _WIN32
00039 #define DLLAPI __declspec(dllimport)
00040 #else
00041 #define DLLAPI
00042 #endif
00043 #endif
00044 
00045 #if ! HAVE_STREAMBUF_CHAR_TYPE
00046 typedef char char_type;
00047 #endif
00048 
00049 /*
00050  *  fcgi_streambuf
00051  */
00052 class DLLAPI fcgi_streambuf : public std::streambuf
00053 {
00054 public:
00055 
00056     // Note that if no buf is assigned (the default), iostream methods
00057     // such as peek(), unget() and putback() will fail.  If a buf is
00058     // assigned, I/O is a bit less effecient and output streams will
00059     // have to be flushed (or the streambuf destroyed) before the next 
00060     // call to "accept".
00061     fcgi_streambuf(FCGX_Stream * fcgx, char * buf, int len);
00062     
00063     fcgi_streambuf(char_type * buf, std::streamsize len);
00064     
00065     fcgi_streambuf(FCGX_Stream * fcgx = 0);
00066 
00067     ~fcgi_streambuf(void);
00068 
00069     int attach(FCGX_Stream * fcgx);
00070 
00071 protected:
00072 
00073     // Consume the put area (if buffered) and c (if c is not EOF).
00074     virtual int overflow(int);
00075 
00076     // Flush the put area (if buffered) and the FCGX buffer to the client.
00077     virtual int sync();
00078 
00079     // Remove and return the current character.
00080     virtual int uflow();
00081 
00082     // Fill the get area (if buffered) and return the current character.
00083     virtual int underflow();
00084 
00085     // Use a buffer.  The only reasons that a buffer would be useful is
00086     // to support the use of the unget()/putback() or seek() methods.  Using
00087     // a buffer will result in less efficient I/O.  Note: the underlying
00088     // FastCGI library (FCGX) maintains its own input and output buffers.  
00089     virtual std::streambuf * setbuf(char_type * buf, std::streamsize len);
00090 
00091     virtual std::streamsize xsgetn(char_type * s, std::streamsize n);
00092     virtual std::streamsize xsputn(const char_type * s, std::streamsize n);
00093 
00094 private:
00095 
00096     FCGX_Stream * fcgx;
00097 
00098     // buf is just handy to have around
00099     char_type * buf;
00100 
00101     // this isn't kept by the base class
00102     std::streamsize bufsize;
00103     
00104     void init(FCGX_Stream * fcgx, char_type * buf, std::streamsize bufsize);
00105 
00106     void reset(void);
00107 };
00108 
00109 /*
00110  *  fcgi_istream - deprecated
00111  */
00112 class DLLAPI fcgi_istream : public std::istream
00113 {
00114 public:
00115 
00116     // deprecated
00117     fcgi_istream(FCGX_Stream * fcgx = 0);
00118     
00119     // deprecated
00120     ~fcgi_istream(void) {}
00121 
00122     // deprecated
00123     virtual void attach(FCGX_Stream * fcgx);
00124 
00125 private:
00126 
00127     fcgi_streambuf fcgi_strmbuf;
00128 };
00129 
00130 /*
00131  *  fcgi_ostream - deprecated
00132  */
00133 class DLLAPI fcgi_ostream : public std::ostream
00134 {
00135 public:
00136     
00137     // deprecated
00138     fcgi_ostream(FCGX_Stream * fcgx = 0);
00139     
00140     // deprecated
00141     ~fcgi_ostream(void) {}
00142 
00143     // deprecated
00144     virtual void attach(FCGX_Stream *fcgx);
00145 
00146 private:
00147 
00148     fcgi_streambuf fcgi_strmbuf;
00149 };
00150 
00151 #endif /* FCGIO_H */
